CVE-2012-0365.extra: A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary operating system commands with root privileges on the target device.A remote user can upload files to the target system.A remote user can upload an arbitrary configuration file.

CVE-2012-0381.title: Cisco IOS IKE Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2012-0381.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted Internet Key Exchange (IKE) data to cause the target device to reload.Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCts38429 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-0381.extra: A remote user can cause the target device to reload.

CVE-2012-0383.title: Cisco IOS SIP NAT Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2012-0383.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) packets via the target device to consume excessive memory and cause the target device to reload or become unstable.Packets requiring network address translation (NAT) on the SIP payload can trigger this flaw.Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCti35326 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-0383.extra: A remote user can consume excessive memory on the target device.

CVE-2012-0384.title: Cisco IOS Lets Remote Authenticated Users Bypass Command Authorization Level Controls
CVE-2012-0384.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote authenticated user can bypass command authorization level controls.A remote authenticated user can connect via HTTP or HTTPS and execute arbitrary Cisco IOS commands that are configured for their authorization level.Devices with an HTTP or HTTPS server configured are affected.Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtr91106 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-0384.extra: A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary Cisco IOS commands that are configured for their authorization level.

CVE-2012-0385.title: Cisco IOS Smart Install Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2012-0385.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a specially crafted Smart Install message on TCP port 4786 to cause the target device to reload.Devices configured as a Smart Install client or director are affected.Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtt16051 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-0385.extra: A remote user can cause the target device to reload.

CVE-2012-0386.title: Cisco IOS Reverse SSHv2 Login Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2012-0386.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can attempt a reverse SSH login using a specially crafted username value to cause the target device to reload.Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtr49064 to this vulnerability.Systems with SSHv2 logins permitted are affected.Cisco IOS XE is also affected.
CVE-2012-0386.extra: A remote user can cause the target device to reload.

CVE-2012-0387.title: Cisco IOS Zone-Based Firewall IP/HTTP/H.323/SIP Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2012-0387.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in the Cisco IOS Zone-Based Firewall feature. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted data to the target device to trigger a memory leak and cause the target system to reload or become unstable.Specially crafted IP packets can trigger this flaw [CVE-2012-1310]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCto89536 to this vulnerability.A specially crafted HTTP packet sent to or via the target device can trigger this flaw in the HTTP Inspection Engine [CVE-2012-0387]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtq36153 to this vulnerability.A specially crafted H.323 message sent to or via the target device can trigger this flaw in the H.323 inspection feature [CVE-2012-0388]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtq45553 to this vulnerability.Specially crafted SIP messages sent to or via the target device can trigger this flaw in the SIP Inspection feature [CVE-2012-1315]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCti46171 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-0387.extra: A remote user can cause the target system to reload or become unstable.

CVE-2012-0388.title: Cisco IOS Zone-Based Firewall IP/HTTP/H.323/SIP Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2012-0388.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in the Cisco IOS Zone-Based Firewall feature. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted data to the target device to trigger a memory leak and cause the target system to reload or become unstable.Specially crafted IP packets can trigger this flaw [CVE-2012-1310]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCto89536 to this vulnerability.A specially crafted HTTP packet sent to or via the target device can trigger this flaw in the HTTP Inspection Engine [CVE-2012-0387]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtq36153 to this vulnerability.A specially crafted H.323 message sent to or via the target device can trigger this flaw in the H.323 inspection feature [CVE-2012-0388]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtq45553 to this vulnerability.Specially crafted SIP messages sent to or via the target device can trigger this flaw in the SIP Inspection feature [CVE-2012-1315]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCti46171 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-0388.extra: A remote user can cause the target system to reload or become unstable.

CVE-2012-0389.title: MailEnable Input Validation Flaw in 'ForgottenPassword.aspx' Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2012-0389.body: A vulnerability was reported in MailEnable. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The webmail interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the MailEnable webmail interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The "Username" parameter of the "ForgottonPassword.aspx" page is affected.A demonstration exploit URL is provided:http://[target]/mewebmail/Mondo/lang/sys/ForgottenPassword.aspx?Username='};alert(/XSS/);{'MailEnable Professional, Enterprise, and Premium are affected.MailEnable Standard is not affected.The vendor was notified on January 4, 2012.Sajjad Pourali, Narendra Shinde, and Shahab NamaziKhah reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-0389.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the MailEnable webmail interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2012-0396.title: EMC Documentum xPlore Search Lets Remote Authenticated Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
CVE-2012-0396.body: A vulnerability was reported in EMC Documentum. A remote authenticated user can view potentially sensitive information.A remote authenticated user that does not have BROWSE permission on the target object can conduct an xPlore search to view certain metadata or determine if certain metadata exists.The user cannot open the target object or view the property details.
CVE-2012-0396.extra: A remote authenticated user without BROWSE permission on the target object may be able to view certain metadata or determine if certain metadata exists.

CVE-2012-0399.title: RSA enVision Bugs Permit Cross-Site Scripting, SQL Injection, and Directory Traversal Attacks
CVE-2012-0399.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in RSA enVision. A remote user can access the system. A remote authenticated user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote authenticated user can inject SQL commands. A remote authenticated user can view files on the target system.The system does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2012-0399]. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the RSA enVision interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The system does not properly restrict excessive authentication attempts [CVE-2012-0400]. A remote user can conduct brute force password guessing attacks.The system does not properly validate user-supplied input [CVE-2012-0401]. A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.The system has hardcoded authentication credentials [CVE-2012-0402]. A remote user can access the system using these credentials.A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted request to view files on the target system [CVE-2012-0403].Filip Palian reported some of these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2012-0399.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the RSA enVision interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote authenticated user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.A remote authenticated user can view files on the target system.A remote user can conduct brute force password guessing attacks.

CVE-2012-0406.title: EMC Data Protection Advisor Server and Collector Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2012-0406.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in EMC Data Protection Advisor. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted data to the Controller, Listener, or Collector processes to trigger a NULL pointer dereference and causes a process crash [CVE-2012-0406].A remote user can send specially crafted data to the Controller, Listener, or Collector processes to trigger an integer overflow and cause a busy-wait condition that will consume excessive CPU resources [CVE-2012-0407].
CVE-2012-0406.extra: A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources or cause a process crash on the target system.

CVE-2012-0407.title: EMC Data Protection Advisor Server and Collector Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2012-0407.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in EMC Data Protection Advisor. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted data to the Controller, Listener, or Collector processes to trigger a NULL pointer dereference and causes a process crash [CVE-2012-0406].A remote user can send specially crafted data to the Controller, Listener, or Collector processes to trigger an integer overflow and cause a busy-wait condition that will consume excessive CPU resources [CVE-2012-0407].
CVE-2012-0407.extra: A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources or cause a process crash on the target system.

CVE-2012-0409.title: EMC AutoStart Buffer Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2012-0409.body: A vulnerability was reported in EMC AutoStart. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service. gwslabs.com reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.
CVE-2012-0409.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2012-0410.title: Novell GroupWise WebAccess Directory Traversal Flaw Lets Remote Users View Files
CVE-2012-0410.body: A vulnerability was reported in Novell GroupWise WebAccess. A remote user can view files on the target system.The software does not properly validate user-supplied input in the 'User.interface' parameter. A remote user can supply a specially crafted request to view files on target system under the WebAccess directory structure.Tim Brown with Portcullis Computer Security, LTD, reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-0410.extra: A remote user can view files on the target system under the WebAccess directory structure.

CVE-2012-0417.title: Novell GroupWise Internet Agent Integer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2012-0417.body: A vulnerability was reported in Novell GroupWise. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger an integer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.Francis Provencher reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint ZDI.
CVE-2012-0417.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2012-0428.title: Novell eDirectory Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2012-0428.body: A vulnerability was reported in Novell eDirectory. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Novell eDirectory software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Positive Technologies Positive Research Center reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-0428.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Novell eDirectory software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2012-0440.title: Bugzilla Bugs Permit Remote Cross-Site Request Forgery and Remote Authenticated Account Impersonation Attacks
CVE-2012-0440.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Bugzilla. A remote authenticated user can impersonate another user account. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.A remote authenticated user can impersonate another user account by registering an email address containing non-ASCII characters [CVE-2012-0448].'jsonrpc.cgi' does not properly validate POST requests [CVE-2012-0440]. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks to take actions on the site acting as the target user. Version 3.4.x and prior versions are not affected.
CVE-2012-0440.extra: A remote authenticated user can impersonate another user account.A remote user can take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2012-0448.title: Bugzilla Bugs Permit Remote Cross-Site Request Forgery and Remote Authenticated Account Impersonation Attacks
CVE-2012-0448.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Bugzilla. A remote authenticated user can impersonate another user account. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.A remote authenticated user can impersonate another user account by registering an email address containing non-ASCII characters [CVE-2012-0448].'jsonrpc.cgi' does not properly validate POST requests [CVE-2012-0440]. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks to take actions on the site acting as the target user. Version 3.4.x and prior versions are not affected.
CVE-2012-0448.extra: A remote authenticated user can impersonate another user account.A remote user can take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2012-0451.title: Mozilla Thunderbird Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2012-0451.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Mozilla Thunderbird. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-0461, CVE-2012-0462, CVE-2012-0463, CVE-2012-0464]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.When a parent window spawns and closes a child window that uses the file open dialog, a use-after-free error may occur in 'shlwapi.dll' on 32-bit Windows 7 systems and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2012-0454].A drag and drop of javascript: links onto a frame may allow a remote user to conduct cross-site scripting attacks [CVE-2012-0455].A remote user can can trigger a use-after-free in SVG animation to execute arbitrary code [CVE-2012-0457].A remote user can trigger an out-of-bounds memory read in SVGFilter to obtain potentially sensitive information [CVE-2012-0456].A remote user can use a carriage return linefeed injection attacks to introduce new Content Security Policy (CSP) headers and conduct cross-site scripting attacks against sites that have a separate header injection vulnerability [CVE-2012-0451]. Thunderbird 3.1 is not affected by this vulnerability.A remote user may be able to cause a target user to set their home page to a javascript: URL through a drag and drop action [CVE-2012-0458].A remote user can access keyframe's cssText after dynamic modification to potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2012-0459]. Thunderbird 3.1 is not affected by this vulnerability.A remote user can spoof UI elements via the window.fullScreen API [CVE-2012-0460]. Thunderbird 3.1 are not affected by this vulnerability.Bob Clary, Christian Holler, Jesse Ruderman, Nils, Michael Bebenita, Dindog, David Anderson, Jeff Walden, Vincenzo Iozzo and Willem Pinckaers (via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative Pwn2Own contest), Masayuki Nakano, Matt Brubeck, Daniel Glazman of Disruptive Innovations, Mariusz Mlynski, Mike Brooks of Sitewatch, Atte Kettunen from OUSPG, Soroush Dalili, and Blair Strang and Scott Bell of Security Assessment reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2012-0451.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the target site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2012-0453.title: Bugzilla Input Validation Flaw in XML-RPC API Permits Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
CVE-2012-0453.body: A vulnerability was reported in Bugzilla. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.The XML-RPC API (xmlrpc.cgi) does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by a target authenticated user, will cause an arbitrary request to be submitted by the target user's browser. The code will be able to take actions on the site acting as the target user.Systems running under mod_cgi are not affected.
CVE-2012-0453.extra: A remote user can take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2012-0456.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-0461, CVE-2012-0462, CVE-2012-0463, CVE-2012-0464]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.When a parent window spawns and closes a child window that uses the file open dialog, a use-after-free error may occur in 'shlwapi.dll' on 32-bit Windows 7 systems and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2012-0454].A drag and drop of javascript: links onto a frame may allow a remote user to conduct cross-site scripting attacks [CVE-2012-0455].A remote user can can trigger a use-after-free in SVG animation to execute arbitrary code [CVE-2012-0457].A remote user can trigger an out-of-bounds memory read in SVGFilter to obtain potentially sensitive information [CVE-2012-0456].A remote user can use a carriage return linefeed injection attacks to introduce new Content Security Policy (CSP) headers and conduct cross-site scripting attacks against sites that have a separate header injection vulnerability [CVE-2012-0451]. Firefox 3.6 is not affected by this vulnerability.A remote user may be able to cause a target user to set their home page to a javascript: URL through a drag and drop action [CVE-2012-0458].A remote user can access keyframe's cssText after dynamic modification to potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2012-0459]. Firefox 3.6 is not affected by this vulnerability.A remote user can spoof UI elements via the window.fullScreen API [CVE-2012-0460]. Firefox 3.6 is not affected by this vulnerability.Bob Clary, Christian Holler, Jesse Ruderman, Nils, Michael Bebenita, Dindog, David Anderson, Jeff Walden, Vincenzo Iozzo and Willem Pinckaers (via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative Pwn2Own contest), Masayuki Nakano, Matt Brubeck, Daniel Glazman of Disruptive Innovations, Mariusz Mlynski, Mike Brooks of Sitewatch, Atte Kettunen from OUSPG, Soroush Dalili, and Blair Strang and Scott Bell of Security Assessment reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2012-0456.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system or obtain potentially sensitive information.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the target site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The code will run with the privileges of the target user.When a parent window spawns and closes a child window that uses the file open dialog, a use-after-free error may occur in 'shlwapi.dll' on 32-bit Windows 7 systems and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2012-0454].A drag and drop of javascript: links onto a frame may allow a remote user to conduct cross-site scripting attacks [CVE-2012-0455].A remote user can can trigger a use-after-free in SVG animation to execute arbitrary code [CVE-2012-0457].A remote user can trigger an out-of-bounds memory read in SVGFilter to obtain potentially sensitive information [CVE-2012-0456].A remote user can use a carriage return linefeed injection attacks to introduce new Content Security Policy (CSP) headers and conduct cross-site scripting attacks against sites that have a separate header injection vulnerability [CVE-2012-0451].A remote user may be able to cause a target user to set their home page to a javascript: URL through a drag and drop action [CVE-2012-0458].A remote user can access keyframe's cssText after dynamic modification to potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2012-0459].A remote user can spoof UI elements via the window.fullScreen API [CVE-2012-0460].Bob Clary, Christian Holler, Jesse Ruderman, Nils, Michael Bebenita, Dindog, David Anderson, Jeff Walden, Vincenzo Iozzo and Willem Pinckaers (via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative Pwn2Own contest), Masayuki Nakano, Matt Brubeck, Daniel Glazman of Disruptive Innovations, Mariusz Mlynski, Mike Brooks of Sitewatch, Atte Kettunen from OUSPG, Soroush Dalili, and Blair Strang and Scott Bell of Security Assessment reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2012-0460.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the target site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The code will run with the privileges of the target user.When a parent window spawns and closes a child window that uses the file open dialog, a use-after-free error may occur in 'shlwapi.dll' on 32-bit Windows 7 systems and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2012-0454].A drag and drop of javascript: links onto a frame may allow a remote user to conduct cross-site scripting attacks [CVE-2012-0455].A remote user can can trigger a use-after-free in SVG animation to execute arbitrary code [CVE-2012-0457].A remote user can trigger an out-of-bounds memory read in SVGFilter to obtain potentially sensitive information [CVE-2012-0456].A remote user can use a carriage return linefeed injection attacks to introduce new Content Security Policy (CSP) headers and conduct cross-site scripting attacks against sites that have a separate header injection vulnerability [CVE-2012-0451]. CVE-2012-0584.title: Apple Safari Bugs Let Remote Users Spoof the URL Address Bar, Bypass Cookie Restrictions, and Obtain Authentication Information
CVE-2012-0584.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Apple Safari. A remote user can spoof URLs. A remote user can bypass cookie restrictions. A remote user can obtain HTTP authentication credentials.A remote user can create a specially crafted URL containing International Domain Name (IDN) characters to load a spoofed site that appears to have an arbitrary URL in the address bar [CVE-2012-0584]. Only Windows-based systems are affected. Matt Cooley of Symantec reported this vulnerability.A remote 3rd-party web site can set a cookie even if the browser is configured to block 3rd-party cookies [CVE-2012-0640]. nshah reported this vulnerability.When a remote site uses HTTP authentication and redirects to another site, the HTTP authentication credentials may be sent to the other site [CVE-2012-0647]. An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-0584.extra: A remote user can spoof URLs.A remote user can bypass cookie restrictions.A remote user can obtain HTTP authentication credentials in certain cases.

CVE-2012-0585.title: Apple iOS Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks, and Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
CVE-2012-0585.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Apple iOS. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. A local user can bypass the screen lock.A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by the target user, will cause CFNetwork to send unexpected request headers and disclose potentially sensitive information [CVE-2012-0641].A user can create a specially crafted HFS disk image that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an integer underflow and cause the system to shutdown or execute arbitrary code [CVE-2012-0642].A user can run a specially crafted program to exploit a bug in the handling of debug system calls and bypass sandbox restrictions [CVE-2012-0643].A physically local user can bypass the screen lock passcode function [CVE-2012-0644].A remote user can cause web page visits to be recorded in the browser history when Private Browsing is active by exploiting the JavaScript methods pushState and replaceState [CVE-2012-0585].A physically local user can use Siri to access a front-most email message selected behind a lock screen [CVE-2012-0645].A remote user can create a specially crafted Racoon configuration file to trigger a format string flaw and execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2012-0646].A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser [CVE-2012-0586, CVE-2012-0587, CVE-2012-0588, CVE-2012-0589, CVE-2012-0590]. The code will run in the security context of an arbitrary site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in WebKit and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2011-2825, CVE-2011-2833, CVE-2011-2846, CVE-2011-2847, CVE-2011-2854, CVE-2011-2855, CVE-2011-2857, CVE-2011-2860, CVE-2011-2867, CVE-2011-2868, CVE-2011-2869, CVE-2011-2870, CVE-2011-2871, CVE-2011-2872, CVE-2011-2873, CVE-2011-3908, CVE-2011-3909, CVE-2012-0591, CVE-2012-0592, CVE-2012-0593, CVE-2012-0594, CVE-2012-0595, CVE-2012-0596, CVE-2012-0597, CVE-2012-0598, CVE-2012-0599, CVE-2012-0600, CVE-2012-0601, CVE-2012-0602, CVE-2012-0603, CVE-2012-0604, CVE-2012-0605, CVE-2012-0606, CVE-2012-0607, CVE-2012-0608, CVE-2012-0609, CVE-2012-0610, CVE-2012-0611, CVE-2012-0612, CVE-2012-0613, CVE-2012-0614, CVE-2012-0615, CVE-2012-0616, CVE-2012-0617, CVE-2012-0618, CVE-2012-0619, CVE-2012-0620, CVE-2012-0621, CVE-2012-0622, CVE-2012-0623, CVE-2012-0624, CVE-2012-0625, CVE-2012-0626, CVE-2012-0627, CVE-2012-0628, CVE-2012-0629, CVE-2012-0630, CVE-2012-0631, CVE-2012-0632, CVE-2012-0633, CVE-2012-0635]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The following researchers reported these vulnerabilities:AppleSergey GlazunovJochen Eisinger of Google Chrome TeamAlan Austin of polyvore.comAdam Barth of Google Chrome Security TeamEric Melville of American ExpressRoland Kohler of the German Federal Ministry of Economics and Technologypod2g2012 iOS Jailbreak Dream TeamErling Ellingsen of FacebookGoogle Chrome Security Team (scarybeasts)wushi of team509 (via iDefense VCP and TippingPoint ZDI)ChuArthur GerkisDirk SchulzeAlexander Gavrun (via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative)Lei Zhang of the Chromium development communityAdam Klein of the Chromium development communityDmytro Gorbunov of SaveSources.comMarshall GreenblattDharani Govindan of Google ChromeAki Helin of OUSPGDave Levin of the Google Chrome Security TeamMartin Barbella using AddressSanitizerSlawomir BlazekmiaubizSergio Villar Senin of IgaliaAbhishek Arya (Inferno) of Google Chrome Security TeamCris Neckar of the Google Chrome Security Team using AddressSanitizerJulien Chaffraix of the Chromium development communityMartin Barbella using AddressSanitizer
CVE-2012-0585.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with an arbitrary site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A local user can bypass the screen lock.

A local user can bypass the screen lock.A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by the target user, will cause CFNetwork to send unexpected request headers and disclose potentially sensitive information [CVE-2012-0641].A user can create a specially crafted HFS disk image that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an integer underflow and cause the system to shutdown or execute arbitrary code [CVE-2012-0642].A user can run a specially crafted program to exploit a bug in the handling of debug system calls and bypass sandbox restrictions [CVE-2012-0643].A physically local user can bypass the screen lock passcode function [CVE-2012-0644].A remote user can cause web page visits to be recorded in the browser history when Private Browsing is active by exploiting the JavaScript methods pushState and replaceState [CVE-2012-0585].A physically local user can use Siri to access a front-most email message selected behind a lock screen [CVE-2012-0645].A remote user can create a specially crafted Racoon configuration file to trigger a format string flaw and execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2012-0646].A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser [CVE-2012-0586, CVE-2012-0587, CVE-2012-0588, CVE-2012-0589, CVE-2012-0590]. The code will run in the security context of an arbitrary site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in WebKit and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2011-2825, CVE-2011-2833, CVE-2011-2846, CVE-2011-2847, CVE-2011-2854, CVE-2011-2855, CVE-2011-2857, CVE-2011-2860, CVE-2011-2867, CVE-2011-2868, CVE-2011-2869, CVE-2011-2870, CVE-2011-2871, CVE-2011-2872, CVE-2011-2873, CVE-2011-3908, CVE-2011-3909, CVE-2012-0591, CVE-2012-0592, CVE-2012-0593, CVE-2012-0594, CVE-2012-0595, CVE-2012-0596, CVE-2012-0597, CVE-2012-0598, CVE-2012-0599, CVE-2012-0600, CVE-2012-0601, CVE-2012-0602, CVE-2012-0603, CVE-2012-0604, CVE-2012-0605, CVE-2012-0606, CVE-2012-0607, CVE-2012-0608, CVE-2012-0609, CVE-2012-0610, CVE-2012-0611, CVE-2012-0612, CVE-2012-0613, CVE-2012-0614, CVE-2012-0615, CVE-2012-0616, CVE-2012-0617, CVE-2012-0618, CVE-2012-0619, CVE-2012-0620, CVE-2012-0621, CVE-2012-0622, CVE-2012-0623, CVE-2012-0624, CVE-2012-0625, CVE-2012-0626, CVE-2012-0627, CVE-2012-0628, CVE-2012-0629, CVE-2012-0630, CVE-2012-0631, CVE-2012-0632, CVE-2012-0633, CVE-2012-0635]. A local user can bypass the screen lock.A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by the target user, will cause CFNetwork to send unexpected request headers and disclose potentially sensitive information [CVE-2012-0641].A user can create a specially crafted HFS disk image that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an integer underflow and cause the system to shutdown or execute arbitrary code [CVE-2012-0642].A user can run a specially crafted program to exploit a bug in the handling of debug system calls and bypass sandbox restrictions [CVE-2012-0643].A physically local user can bypass the screen lock passcode function [CVE-2012-0644].A remote user can cause web page visits to be recorded in the browser history when Private Browsing is active by exploiting the JavaScript methods pushState and replaceState [CVE-2012-0585].A physically local user can use Siri to access a front-most email message selected behind a lock screen [CVE-2012-0645].A remote user can create a specially crafted Racoon configuration file to trigger a format string flaw and execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2012-0646].A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser [CVE-2012-0586, CVE-2012-0587, CVE-2012-0588, CVE-2012-0589, CVE-2012-0590]. The code will run in the security context of an arbitrary site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in WebKit and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2011-2825, CVE-2011-2833, CVE-2011-2846, CVE-2011-2847, CVE-2011-2854, CVE-2011-2855, CVE-2011-2857, CVE-2011-2860, CVE-2011-2867, CVE-2011-2868, CVE-2011-2869, CVE-2011-2870, CVE-2011-2871, CVE-2011-2872, CVE-2011-2873, CVE-2011-3908, CVE-2011-3909, CVE-2012-0591, CVE-2012-0592, CVE-2012-0593, CVE-2012-0594, CVE-2012-0595, CVE-2012-0596, CVE-2012-0597, CVE-2012-0598, CVE-2012-0599, CVE-2012-0600, CVE-2012-0601, CVE-2012-0602, CVE-2012-0603, CVE-2012-0604, CVE-2012-0605, CVE-2012-0606, CVE-2012-0607, CVE-2012-0608, CVE-2012-0609, CVE-2012-0610, CVE-2012-0611, CVE-2012-0612, CVE-2012-0613, CVE-2012-0614, CVE-2012-0615, CVE-2012-0616, CVE-2012-0617, CVE-2012-0618, CVE-2012-0619, CVE-2012-0620, CVE-2012-0621, CVE-2012-0622, CVE-2012-0623, CVE-2012-0624, CVE-2012-0625, CVE-2012-0626, CVE-2012-0627, CVE-2012-0628, CVE-2012-0629, CVE-2012-0630, CVE-2012-0631, CVE-2012-0632, CVE-2012-0633, CVE-2012-0635]. A local user can bypass the screen lock.A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by the target user, will cause CFNetwork to send unexpected request headers and disclose potentially sensitive information [CVE-2012-0641].A user can create a specially crafted HFS disk image that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an integer underflow and cause the system to shutdown or execute arbitrary code [CVE-2012-0642].A user can run a specially crafted program to exploit a bug in the handling of debug system calls and bypass sandbox restrictions [CVE-2012-0643].A physically local user can bypass the screen lock passcode function [CVE-2012-0644].A remote user can cause web page visits to be recorded in the browser history when Private Browsing is active by exploiting the JavaScript methods pushState and replaceState [CVE-2012-0585].A physically local user can use Siri to access a front-most email message selected behind a lock screen [CVE-2012-0645].A remote user can create a specially crafted Racoon configuration file to trigger a format string flaw and execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2012-0646].A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser [CVE-2012-0586, CVE-2012-0587, CVE-2012-0588, CVE-2012-0589, CVE-2012-0590]. The code will run in the security context of an arbitrary site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in WebKit and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2011-2825, CVE-2011-2833, CVE-2011-2846, CVE-2011-2847, CVE-2011-2854, CVE-2011-2855, CVE-2011-2857, CVE-2011-2860, CVE-2011-2867, CVE-2011-2868, CVE-2011-2869, CVE-2011-2870, CVE-2011-2871, CVE-2011-2872, CVE-2011-2873, CVE-2011-3908, CVE-2011-3909, CVE-2012-0591, CVE-2012-0592, CVE-2012-0593, CVE-2012-0594, CVE-2012-0595, CVE-2012-0596, CVE-2012-0597, CVE-2012-0598, CVE-2012-0599, CVE-2012-0600, CVE-2012-0601, CVE-2012-0602, CVE-2012-0603, CVE-2012-0604, CVE-2012-0605, CVE-2012-0606, CVE-2012-0607, CVE-2012-0608, CVE-2012-0609, CVE-2012-0610, CVE-2012-0611, CVE-2012-0612, CVE-2012-0613, CVE-2012-0614, CVE-2012-0615, CVE-2012-0616, CVE-2012-0617, CVE-2012-0618, CVE-2012-0619, CVE-2012-0620, CVE-2012-0621, CVE-2012-0622, CVE-2012-0623, CVE-2012-0624, CVE-2012-0625, CVE-2012-0626, CVE-2012-0627, CVE-2012-0628, CVE-2012-0629, CVE-2012-0630, CVE-2012-0631, CVE-2012-0632, CVE-2012-0633, CVE-2012-0635]. A local user can bypass the screen lock.A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by the target user, will cause CFNetwork to send unexpected request headers and disclose potentially sensitive information [CVE-2012-0641].A user can create a specially crafted HFS disk image that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an integer underflow and cause the system to shutdown or execute arbitrary code [CVE-2012-0642].A user can run a specially crafted program to exploit a bug in the handling of debug system calls and bypass sandbox restrictions [CVE-2012-0643].A physically local user can bypass the screen lock passcode function [CVE-2012-0644].A remote user can cause web page visits to be recorded in the browser history when Private Browsing is active by exploiting the JavaScript methods pushState and replaceState [CVE-2012-0585].A physically local user can use Siri to access a front-most email message selected behind a lock screen [CVE-2012-0645].A remote user can create a specially crafted Racoon configuration file to trigger a format string flaw and execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2012-0646].A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser [CVE-2012-0586, CVE-2012-0587, CVE-2012-0588, CVE-2012-0589, CVE-2012-0590]. The code will run in the security context of an arbitrary site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in WebKit and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2011-2825, CVE-2011-2833, CVE-2011-2846, CVE-2011-2847, CVE-2011-2854, CVE-2011-2855, CVE-2011-2857, CVE-2011-2860, CVE-2011-2867, CVE-2011-2868, CVE-2011-2869, CVE-2011-2870, CVE-2011-2871, CVE-2011-2872, CVE-2011-2873, CVE-2011-3908, CVE-2011-3909, CVE-2012-0591, CVE-2012-0592, CVE-2012-0593, CVE-2012-0594, CVE-2012-0595, CVE-2012-0596, CVE-2012-0597, CVE-2012-0598, CVE-2012-0599, CVE-2012-0600, CVE-2012-0601, CVE-2012-0602, CVE-2012-0603, CVE-2012-0604, CVE-2012-0605, CVE-2012-0606, CVE-2012-0607, CVE-2012-0608, CVE-2012-0609, CVE-2012-0610, CVE-2012-0611, CVE-2012-0612, CVE-2012-0613, CVE-2012-0614, CVE-2012-0615, CVE-2012-0616, CVE-2012-0617, CVE-2012-0618, CVE-2012-0619, CVE-2012-0620, CVE-2012-0621, CVE-2012-0622, CVE-2012-0623, CVE-2012-0624, CVE-2012-0625, CVE-2012-0626, CVE-2012-0627, CVE-2012-0628, CVE-2012-0629, CVE-2012-0630, CVE-2012-0631, CVE-2012-0632, CVE-2012-0633, CVE-2012-0635]. CVE-2012-0640.title: Apple Safari Bugs Let Remote Users Spoof the URL Address Bar, Bypass Cookie Restrictions, and Obtain Authentication Information
CVE-2012-0640.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Apple Safari. A remote user can spoof URLs. A remote user can bypass cookie restrictions. A remote user can obtain HTTP authentication credentials.A remote user can create a specially crafted URL containing International Domain Name (IDN) characters to load a spoofed site that appears to have an arbitrary URL in the address bar [CVE-2012-0584]. Only Windows-based systems are affected. Matt Cooley of Symantec reported this vulnerability.A remote 3rd-party web site can set a cookie even if the browser is configured to block 3rd-party cookies [CVE-2012-0640]. nshah reported this vulnerability.When a remote site uses HTTP authentication and redirects to another site, the HTTP authentication credentials may be sent to the other site [CVE-2012-0647]. An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-0640.extra: A remote user can spoof URLs.A remote user can bypass cookie restrictions.A remote user can obtain HTTP authentication credentials in certain cases.

CVE-2012-0647.title: Apple Safari Bugs Let Remote Users Spoof the URL Address Bar, Bypass Cookie Restrictions, and Obtain Authentication Information
CVE-2012-0647.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Apple Safari. A remote user can spoof URLs. A remote user can bypass cookie restrictions. A remote user can obtain HTTP authentication credentials.A remote user can create a specially crafted URL containing International Domain Name (IDN) characters to load a spoofed site that appears to have an arbitrary URL in the address bar [CVE-2012-0584]. Only Windows-based systems are affected. Matt Cooley of Symantec reported this vulnerability.A remote 3rd-party web site can set a cookie even if the browser is configured to block 3rd-party cookies [CVE-2012-0640]. nshah reported this vulnerability.When a remote site uses HTTP authentication and redirects to another site, the HTTP authentication credentials may be sent to the other site [CVE-2012-0647]. An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-0647.extra: A remote user can spoof URLs.A remote user can bypass cookie restrictions.A remote user can obtain HTTP authentication credentials in certain cases.

CVE-2012-0652.title: Mac OS X FileVault Discloses Passwords to Local Users in Certain Cases
CVE-2012-0652.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X. A local user can obtain passwords.On systems that used FileVault encryption prior to OS X Lion (version 10.7.3) and have since been updated to OS X Lion version 10.7.3, user login passwords are stored in a log file in clear text. A local user with root or admin privileges can view the passwords.FileVault 2 is not affected.Terry Reeves and Tim Winningham of the Ohio State University, Markus 'Jaroneko' Raty of the Finnish Academy of Fine Arts, Jaakko Pero of Aalto University, Mark Cohen of Oregon State University, and Paul Nelson reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-0652.extra: A local user with root or admin privileges can obtain user login passwords.

CVE-2012-0663.title: Apple QuickTime Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2012-0663.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Apple QuickTime. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Only Windows-based systems are affected.A file opened from a specially crafted path can trigger a stack overflow [CVE-2012-0265].A specially crafted TeXML file can trigger a stack overflow [CVE-2012-0663].A specially crafted text track in a movie file can trigger a heap overflow [CVE-2012-0664].A specially crafted H.264 encoded movie file can trigger a heap overflow [CVE-2012-0665].A specially rafted QTMovie object can trigger a stack overflow [CVE-2012-0666].A specially crafted QTVR movie file can trigger a signedness error [CVE-2012-0667].A specially crafted RLE encoded movie file can trigger a buffer overflow [CVE-2012-0668].A specially crafted Sorenson encoded movie file can trigger a buffer overflow [CVE-2012-0669].A specially crafted QuickTime sean atom can trigger an integer overflow [CVE-2012-0670].A specially crafted '.pict' file can trigger a memory corruption error [CVE-2012-0671].Tielei Wang of Georgia Tech Information Security Center (via Secunia SVCRP), Alexander Gavrun working (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), Luigi Auriemma (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), CHkr_D591 (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), Alin Rad Pop (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), Damian Put (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), and Tom Gallagher (Microsoft) and Paul Bates (Microsoft) HP's Zero Day Initiative, Rodrigo Rubira Branco from the Qualys Vulnerability & Malware Research Labs (VMRL) reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2012-0663.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Only Windows-based systems are affected.A file opened from a specially crafted path can trigger a stack overflow [CVE-2012-0265].A specially crafted TeXML file can trigger a stack overflow [CVE-2012-0663].A specially crafted text track in a movie file can trigger a heap overflow [CVE-2012-0664].A specially crafted H.264 encoded movie file can trigger a heap overflow [CVE-2012-0665].A specially rafted QTMovie object can trigger a stack overflow [CVE-2012-0666].A specially crafted QTVR movie file can trigger a signedness error [CVE-2012-0667].A specially crafted RLE encoded movie file can trigger a buffer overflow [CVE-2012-0668].A specially crafted Sorenson encoded movie file can trigger a buffer overflow [CVE-2012-0669].A specially crafted QuickTime sean atom can trigger an integer overflow [CVE-2012-0670].A specially crafted '.pict' file can trigger a memory corruption error [CVE-2012-0671].Tielei Wang of Georgia Tech Information Security Center (via Secunia SVCRP), Alexander Gavrun working (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), Luigi Auriemma (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), CHkr_D591 (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), Alin Rad Pop (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), Damian Put (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), and Tom Gallagher (Microsoft) and Paul Bates (Microsoft) HP's Zero Day Initiative, Rodrigo Rubira Branco from the Qualys Vulnerability & Malware Research Labs (VMRL) reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2012-0667.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2012-0676.title: Apple Safari WebKit Flaw Lets Remote Users Fill Out Form Inputs on a Target Web Page for a Target User
CVE-2012-0676.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apple Safari. A remote user can cause form inputs to be filled out on a target web page.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will populate form inputs on a target web page with arbitrary values.Andreas Akre Solberg of UNINETT AS, Aaron Roots of Deakin University ITSD, and Tyler Goen reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-0676.extra: A remote user can cause the target user's browser to populate form inputs on a target web page with arbitrary values.

CVE-2012-0696.title: IBM Cognos Input Validation Flaw in Executive Viewer Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2012-0696.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM Cognos Executive Viewer. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The Executive Viewer does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the IBM Cognos software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The '/aspnet_client' and '/evserver/createcontrol.js' pages are affected.
CVE-2012-0696.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the IBM Cognos software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2012-0708.title: IBM Rational ClearQuest Buffer Overflow in ActiveX Control RegisterSchemaRepoFromFileByDbSet() Function Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2012-0708.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM Rational ClearQuest. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow in the RegisterSchemaRepoFromFileByDbSet() function call and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Andrea Micalizzi aka rgod reported these vulnerabilities via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.
CVE-2012-0708.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2012-0723.title: IBM AIX dupmsg() Bug Lets Local Users Deny Service
CVE-2012-0723.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM AIX. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can invoke the dupmsg() call to cause the target system to crash.Jakub Wartak reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-0723.extra: A local user can cause the target system to crash.

CVE-2012-0726.title: IBM Tivoli Directory Server NULL Ciphers Let Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
CVE-2012-0726.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM Tivoli Directory Server. A remote user monitoring the network can obtain potentially sensitive information.The default TLS configuration enables NULL-MD5 and NULL-SHA ciphers. If a TLS cipher negotiation fails to use a strong cipher, the connection may default to a NULL cipher. A remote user monitoring the network between the client and the directory server can obtain potentially sensitive information.
CVE-2012-0726.extra: A remote user monitoring the network can obtain potentially sensitive information.

CVE-2012-0740.title: IBM Tivoli Directory Server Input Validation Flaw in Web Admin Tool Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2012-0740.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM Tivoli Directory Server. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The Web Admin Tool does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the IBM Tivoli Directory Server software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned APARs IO14508, IO16016, and IO16186 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-0740.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the IBM Tivoli Directory Server software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2012-0743.title: IBM Tivoli Directory Server Paged Search Request Processing Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2012-0743.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM Tivoli Directory Server. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a specially crafted request that uses one connection for two separate paged searches to cause the target LDAP service to crash.Systems with paged searches enabled are affected.
CVE-2012-0743.extra: A remote user can cause the LDAP service to crash.

CVE-2012-0745.title: IBM AIX LDAP Authentication Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2012-0745.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM AIX. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can exploit a flaw in the getpwnam() function to gain elevated privileges.Systems configured with customer extended LDAP user filtering are affected.
CVE-2012-0745.extra: A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2012-0765.title: Adobe RoboHelp for Word Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2012-0765.body: A vulnerability was reported in Adobe RoboHelp for Word. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Web-based output generated using RoboHelp for Word and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.David Damstra of CU*Answers reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-0765.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Web-based output generated using RoboHelp for Word, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2012-0772.title: Adobe Flash Player Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2012-0772.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe Flash Player. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted Flash content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A memory corruption error in URL security domain checking can trigger code execution in an ActiveX control, affecting Windows 7 or Vista only [CVE-2012-0772]. Microsoft Vulnerability Research (MSVR) reported this vulnerability.A memory corruption error in the NetStream class can trigger code execution [CVE-2012-0773]. An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.
CVE-2012-0772.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2012-0773.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe Flash Player. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted Flash content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A memory corruption error in URL security domain checking can trigger code execution in an ActiveX control, affecting Windows 7 or Vista only [CVE-2012-0772]. Microsoft Vulnerability Research (MSVR) reported this vulnerability.A memory corruption error in the NetStream class can trigger code execution [CVE-2012-0773]. An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.
CVE-2012-0773.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2012-0774.title: Adobe Acrobat/Reader Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2012-0774.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe Acrobat/Reader. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.An integer overflow in True Type Font (TTF) handling can cause code execution [CVE-2012-0774].A memory corruption error in JavaScript handling can cause code execution [CVE-2012-0775].A security bypass via the Adobe Reader installer can cause code execution [CVE-2012-0776].A memory corruption error in the JavaScript API can cause code execution on Mac OS X and Linux systems [CVE-2012-0777].Peter Vreugdenhil, HP DVLabs, Soroush Dalili, Mitja Kolsek of ACROS Security, and James Quirk, Los Alamos, reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2012-0774.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Tielei Wang, Georgia Tech Information Security Center, reported this vulnerability via Secunia SVCRP.

CVE-2012-0780.title: Adobe Illustrator Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2012-0780.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe Illustrator. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Felipe Andres Manzano (via the iSIGHT Partners Global Vulnerability Partnership), Justin Kim from Microsoft Malware Protection Center (MMPC) and Microsoft Vulnerability Research (MSVR), and Tielei Wang, Georgia Tech Information Security Center, (via Secunia SVCRP) reported these vulnerabilities.
