CVE-2012-1512.title: VMware vSphere Client Input Validation Flaw Permits Script Injection Attacks
CVE-2012-1512.body: A vulnerability was reported in VMware vSphere Client. A remote user can conduct script injection attacks.The vSphere Client internal browser does not properly filter HTML code from log file entries before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted log file that, when opened by the target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed. The code will run with the privileges of the target user. The scripting code can take actions acting as the target user.Edward Torkington reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-1512.extra: A remote user can take actions acting as the target user.

CVE-2012-1513.title: VMware vCenter Orchestrator Discloses Passwords to Remote Authenticated Users
CVE-2012-1513.body: A vulnerability was reported in VMware vCenter Orchestrator. A remote authenticated user can view the vCenter Server password.The vCenter Orchestrator (vCO) Web Configuration tool allows a remote authenticated user to retrieve the vCenter Server password.Alexey Sintsov from Digital Security Research Group reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-1513.extra: A remote authenticated user can view password data.

CVE-2012-1514.title: VMware vShield Manager Permits Cross-Site Request Attacks
CVE-2012-1514.body: A vulnerability was reported in VMware vShield Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will take actions on the target site acting as the target user.Frans Pehrson of Xxor AB and Claudio Criscione independently reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-1514.extra: A remote user can take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2012-1515.title: VMware ESXi and ESX ROM Overwrite Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2012-1515.body: A vulnerability was reported in VMware ESXi and ESX. A local user on the guest operating system can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user on the guest operating system can exploit a flaw in port-based I/O handling to overwrite read-only memory for the virtual DOS machine and gain elevated privileges on the guest OS.Guest operating systems running Windows 2000, Windows XP 32-bit, Windows Server 2003 32-bit, or Windows Server 2003 R2 32-bit are affected. Derek Soeder of Ridgeway Internet Security, L.L.C. reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-1515.extra: A local user on the guest operating system can obtain elevated privileges on the target guest operating system.

CVE-2012-1516.title: VMware ESX/ESXi NFS Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and RPC Pointer Errors Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2012-1516.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in VMware ESX/ESXi. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user on the guest operating system can exploit a flaw in the handler function for RPC commands to cause the VMX process to crash or execute arbitrary code [CVE-2012-1516, CVE-2012-1517].ESXi 5.0 is not affected.Derek Soeder of Ridgeway Internet Security, L.L.C. reported the vulnerabilities listed above.A remote user can send specially crafted NFS traffic to trigger a memory overwrite and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-2448].
CVE-2012-1516.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A local user on the guest operating system can cause the target system to crash or execute arbitrary code.

CVE-2012-1517.title: VMware ESX/ESXi NFS Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and RPC Pointer Errors Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2012-1517.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in VMware ESX/ESXi. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user on the guest operating system can exploit a flaw in the handler function for RPC commands to cause the VMX process to crash or execute arbitrary code [CVE-2012-1516, CVE-2012-1517].ESXi 5.0 is not affected.Derek Soeder of Ridgeway Internet Security, L.L.C. reported the vulnerabilities listed above.A remote user can send specially crafted NFS traffic to trigger a memory overwrite and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-2448].
CVE-2012-1517.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A local user on the guest operating system can cause the target system to crash or execute arbitrary code.

CVE-2012-1518.title: VMware ESX/ESXi VMware Tools Access Control Error Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2012-1518.body: A vulnerability was reported in VMware ESX/ESXi. A local user on a guest operating system can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.On Windows-based guest operating systems, the VMware Tools folder access control list is not properly set. A local user on the guest operating system can gain elevated privileges.Tavis Ormandy reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-1518.extra: A local user on a Windows guest operating system can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2012-1518.title: VMware Workstation/Player/Fusion VMware Tools Access Control Error Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2012-1518.body: A vulnerability was reported in VMware Workstation/Player/Fusion. A local user on a guest operating system can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.On Windows-based guest operating systems, the VMware Tools folder access control list is not properly set. A local user on the guest operating system can gain elevated privileges.Tavis Ormandy reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-1518.extra: A local user on a Windows guest operating system can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2012-1521.title: Google Chrome Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2012-1521.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Google Chrome. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a use-after-free, validation error, or race condition and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A use-after-free may occur in floats handling [CVE-2011-3078]. Google Chrome Security Team (Marty Barbella) and miaubiz reported this vulnerability.An IPC validation failure may occur [CVE-2011-3079]. PinkiePie reported this vulnerability.A race condition may occur in sandbox IPC [CVE-2011-3080]. Willem Pinckaers of Matasano reported this vulnerability.A use-after-free may occur in floats handling [CVE-2011-3081]. miaubiz reported this vulnerability.A use-after-free may occur in the xml parser [CVE-2012-1521]. Google Chrome Security Team (SkyLined) and wushi of team509 (via iDefense VCP) reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-1521.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2012-1527.title: Windows Shell Briefcase Integer Overflow and Underflow Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2012-1527.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Shell. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted briefcase that, when opened by the target user via Windows Explorer, will trigger an integer underflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-1527]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can create a specially crafted briefcase that, when opened by the target user via Windows Explorer, will trigger an integer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-1528]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Tal Zeltzer reported these vulnerabilities via VeriSign iDefense Labs.
CVE-2012-1527.extra: A remote user can create a briefcase that, when opened by the target user via Windows Explorer, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2012-1528.title: Windows Shell Briefcase Integer Overflow and Underflow Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2012-1528.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Shell. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted briefcase that, when opened by the target user via Windows Explorer, will trigger an integer underflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-1527]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can create a specially crafted briefcase that, when opened by the target user via Windows Explorer, will trigger an integer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-1528]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Tal Zeltzer reported these vulnerabilities via VeriSign iDefense Labs.
CVE-2012-1528.extra: A remote user can create a briefcase that, when opened by the target user via Windows Explorer, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2012-1529.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Multiple Use-After-Free Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2012-1529.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a use-after-free flaw and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The onMove() method is affected [CVE-2012-1529]. An anonymous researcher (via VeriSign iDefense Labs) reported this vulnerability.An Event Listener is affected [CVE-2012-2546]. Rosario Valotta reported this vulnerability.A Layout object is affected [CVE-2012-2548]. Stephen Fewer of Harmony Security (via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative) reported this vulnerability.The cloneNode() method is affected [CVE-2012-2557]. An anonymous researcher (via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative) reported this vulnerability.Internet 10 is not affected by these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2012-1529.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2012-1538.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Multiple Use-After-Free Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2012-1538.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a use-after-free memory error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The CFormElement class is affected [CVE-2012-1538].The CTreePos class is affected [CVE-2012-1539].The CTreeNode class is affected [CVE-2012-4775].Jose A. Vazquez of spa-s3c.blogspot.com (via VeriSign iDefense Labs) and Cheng-da Tsai (Orange), Sung-ting Tsai, and Ming-chieh Pan (Nanika) of Trend Micro reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2012-1538.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2012-1539.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Multiple Use-After-Free Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2012-1539.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a use-after-free memory error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The CFormElement class is affected [CVE-2012-1538].The CTreePos class is affected [CVE-2012-1539].The CTreeNode class is affected [CVE-2012-4775].Jose A. Vazquez of spa-s3c.blogspot.com (via VeriSign iDefense Labs) and Cheng-da Tsai (Orange), Sung-ting Tsai, and Ming-chieh Pan (Nanika) of Trend Micro reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2012-1539.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2012-1557.title: Parallels Plesk Unspecified Flaw Lets Remote Users Access and Modify the System
CVE-2012-1557.body: A vulnerability was reported in Parallels Plesk. A remote user can access and modify the system.No details were provided.
CVE-2012-1557.extra: A remote user can access and modify the system.

CVE-2012-1569.title: libtASN1 asn1_der_decoding() Response Handling Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2012-1569.body: A vulnerability was reported in libtASN1. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted data so that the asn1_der_decoding() will return invalid data and cause an error in the calling function(s), resulting in a crash of the target service.Matthew Hall of Mu Dynamics reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-1569.extra: A remote user can cause the target service to crash.

CVE-2012-1573.title: GnuTLS Error in ciphertext_to_compressed() Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2012-1573.body: A vulnerability was reported in GnuTLS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.The software does not properly process records containing data that is a multiple of the block size. A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a heap corruption error and cause the target service to crash.The original advisory is available at:http://blog.mudynamics.com/2012/03/20/gnutls-and-libtasn1-vulns/Matthew Hall of Mu Dynamics reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-1573.extra: A remote user can cause the target service to crash.

CVE-2012-1575.title: Red Hat Enterprise MRG Grid Input Validation Flaw in Cumin Management Console Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2012-1575.body: A vulnerability was reported in Red Hat Enterprise MRG Grid. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The MRG Management Console (Cumin) does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the MRG Management Console software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
CVE-2012-1575.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the MRG Management Console software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2012-1583.title: Linux Kernel Bug in xfrm6_tunnel Module Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2012-1583.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Linux Kernel. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a use-after-free or a double-free memory error in the xfrm6_tunnel_rcv() function and cause the target system to crash.Systems using IPv6 and with the xfrm6_tunnel kernel module loaded are affected.
CVE-2012-1583.extra: A remote user can cause the target system to crash.

CVE-2012-1594.title: Wireshark ANSI A/IEEE 802.11/PCAP/MP2T Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2012-1594.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Wireshark. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target service to crash.A null pointer dereference can be triggered in the ANSI A dissector [CVE-2012-1593].An infinite loop can occur in the IEEE 802.11 dissector [CVE-2012-1594].A memory corruption error can occur in the pcap and pcap-ng file parsers when reading ERF data [CVE-2012-1595].A memory allocation error can occur in the MP2T dissector [CVE-2012-1596].
CVE-2012-1594.extra: A remote user can cause Wireshark to crash.

CVE-2012-1595.title: Wireshark ANSI A/IEEE 802.11/PCAP/MP2T Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2012-1595.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Wireshark. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target service to crash.A null pointer dereference can be triggered in the ANSI A dissector [CVE-2012-1593].An infinite loop can occur in the IEEE 802.11 dissector [CVE-2012-1594].A memory corruption error can occur in the pcap and pcap-ng file parsers when reading ERF data [CVE-2012-1595].A memory allocation error can occur in the MP2T dissector [CVE-2012-1596].
CVE-2012-1595.extra: A remote user can cause Wireshark to crash.

CVE-2012-1596.title: Wireshark ANSI A/IEEE 802.11/PCAP/MP2T Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2012-1596.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Wireshark. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target service to crash.A null pointer dereference can be triggered in the ANSI A dissector [CVE-2012-1593].An infinite loop can occur in the IEEE 802.11 dissector [CVE-2012-1594].A memory corruption error can occur in the pcap and pcap-ng file parsers when reading ERF data [CVE-2012-1595].A memory allocation error can occur in the MP2T dissector [CVE-2012-1596].
CVE-2012-1596.extra: A remote user can cause Wireshark to crash.

CVE-2012-1601.title: KVM Null Pointer Dereference in irqchip_in_kernel() Lets Local Users Deny Service
CVE-2012-1601.body: A vulnerability was reported in KVM. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can trigger a null pointer dereference in irqchip_in_kernel() and cause denial the target system to crash.
CVE-2012-1601.extra: A local user can cause the target system to crash.

CVE-2012-1621.title: Apache OFBiz Input Validation Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2012-1621.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apache OFBiz. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.Several scripts do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the OFBiz software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Error messages returned via ajax requests are affected.Some parameter arrays in freemarker templates are affected.The cms event contentId and mapKey parameters are affected.The Webslinger component is affected.Matias Madou of Fortify/HP Security Research Group reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-1621.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the OFBiz software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2012-1661.title: ArcGIS Desktop User Warning Byass Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2012-1661.body: A vulnerability was reported in ArcGIS Desktop. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted map (.mxd) file that, when loaded by the target user, will bypass a user code execution warning and execute arbitrary embedded VBA code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.ArcMap 9 is also affected.The original advisory is available at:http://www.cs.umb.edu/~joecohen/exploits/CVE-2012-1661Boston Cyber Defense reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-1661.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2012-1662.title: CA ARCserve Backup Network Request Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Disable Network Services
CVE-2012-1662.body: A vulnerability was reported in CA ARCserve Backup for Windows. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted network requests to cause network services to become disabled.
CVE-2012-1662.extra: A remote user can cause network services to become disabled.

CVE-2012-1675.title: Oracle Database Lets Remote Users Hijack TNS Listener Instance Connections
CVE-2012-1675.body: A vulnerability was reported in Oracle Database. A remote user can hijack database instance connections.A remote user can connect to the TNS Listener and register an already registered instance to cause the target TNS Listener to route connections to the remote user's database server.Joxean Koret reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-1675.extra: A remote user can hijack database instance connections.

CVE-2012-1777.title: F5 FirePass Input Validation Flaw in 'my.activation.php3' Lets Remote Users Inject SQL Commands
CVE-2012-1777.body: A vulnerability was reported in F5 FirePass. A remote user can inject SQL commands.The system does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.The 'state' parameter in 'my.activation.php3' is affected.The vendor has assigned ID 377712 to this vulnerability.The vendor was notified on February 3, 2012.The original advisory is available at:https://www.sec-consult.com/files/20120328-0_F5_FirePass_SSL_VPN_unauthenticated_remote_root_v1.0.txtC. Schwarz of SEC Consult Vulnerability Lab reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-1777.extra: A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

CVE-2012-1795.title: Webglimpse 'query' Parameter Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Inject Operating System Commands
CVE-2012-1795.body: A vulnerability was reported in Webglimpse. A remote user can execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system.A remote user can submit a specially crafted URL to inject arbitrary operating system commands on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target web service.A demonstration exploit query value is provided:query=%27%26command+and+arguments+go+here%26%27Kevin Perry reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-1795.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system.

CVE-2012-1798.title: ImageMagick Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Deny Service
CVE-2012-1798.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in ImageMagick. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user or application, will execute arbitrary code or cause denial of service conditions on the target system.Specially crafted exchangeable image file format (Exif) metadata can trigger code execution [CVE-2012-0247].Specially crafted Exif metadata can cause ImageMagick to enter an infinite loop [CVE-2012-0248].Specially crafted Exif tags can trigger an invalid memory access and cause ImageMagick to crash [CVE-2012-0259].Specially crafted JPEG images can cause ImageMagick to consume excessive memory and CPU resources [CVE-2012-0260].Specially crafted Exif IFD values in TIFF images can trigger an out-of-bounds buffer read and cause ImageMagick to crash [CVE-2012-1798].
CVE-2012-1798.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user or application, will execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

CVE-2012-1823.title: PHP Command Parameter Bug Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information and Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2012-1823.body: A vulnerability was reported in PHP. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can submit a specially crafted request containing a command line switch to cause the php-cgi binary to execute the parameter.Systems where PHP is used in a CGI-based setup (e.g., Apache mod_cgi) may be affected.Systems using Apache mod_php or nginx with php-fpm are not affected.A demonstration exploit URL is provided:http://[target]/index.php?-sThis vulnerability is being actively exploited.The original advisory is available at:http://eindbazen.net/2012/05/php-cgi-advisory-cve-2012-1823/De Eindbazen reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-1823.extra: A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2012-1847.title: Microsoft Office Excel File Memory Corruption Errors and Heap Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2012-1847.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Office. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Excel file that, when loaded by the target user via Microsoft Office, will trigger a memory corruption error or heap overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Microsoft Excel Viewer and Microsoft Office Compatibility Pack SP2/SP3 are also affected.Omair (via iDefense), Sean Larsson and Jun Mao (via iDefense), and an anonymous researcher (via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative) reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2012-1847.extra: A remote user can create an Excel file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2012-1848.title: Windows OS Lets Remote Users Cause Arbitrary Code to Be Executed and Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2012-1848.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in the Windows operating system. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A remote user can create a specially crafted TrueType font that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2011-3402, CVE-2012-0159]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A local user can trigger a windows and messages handling flaw in the Windows kernel-mode driver (win32k.sys) to execute arbitrary code in the context of another process [CVE-2012-0180].A local user can trigger a keyboard layout file processing error in the Windows kernel-mode driver (win32k.sys) to execute arbitrary code in the context of another process [CVE-2012-0181].A local user can trigger a scrollbar calculation flaw in the Windows kernel-mode driver (win32k.sys) to execute arbitrary code in the context of another process [CVE-2012-1848].Alin Rad Pop (via Tipping Point's Zero Day Initiative), Tarjei Mandt of Azimuth Security, Nicolas Economou of Core Security Technologies, Geoff McDonald of Symantec, and h4ckmp reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2012-1848.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2012-1885.title: Microsoft Excel Buffer Overflow, Memory Corruption, and Use-After-Free Errors Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2012-1885.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Excel. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Excel file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a heap overflow in SerAuxErrBar() and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-1885]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can create a specially crafted Excel file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-1886]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can create a specially crafted Excel file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an invalid length use-after-free and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-1887]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can create a specially crafted Excel file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-2543]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Sean Larsson (via iDefense VCP), an anonymous researcher (via iDefense VCP), and an anonymous researcher (via HP TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative) reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2012-1885.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2012-1886.title: Microsoft Excel Buffer Overflow, Memory Corruption, and Use-After-Free Errors Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2012-1886.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Excel. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Excel file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a heap overflow in SerAuxErrBar() and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-1885]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can create a specially crafted Excel file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-1886]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can create a specially crafted Excel file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an invalid length use-after-free and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-1887]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can create a specially crafted Excel file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-2543]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Sean Larsson (via iDefense VCP), an anonymous researcher (via iDefense VCP), and an anonymous researcher (via HP TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative) reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2012-1886.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2012-1887.title: Microsoft Excel Buffer Overflow, Memory Corruption, and Use-After-Free Errors Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2012-1887.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Excel. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Excel file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a heap overflow in SerAuxErrBar() and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-1885]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can create a specially crafted Excel file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-1886]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can create a specially crafted Excel file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an invalid length use-after-free and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-1887]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can create a specially crafted Excel file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-2543]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Sean Larsson (via iDefense VCP), an anonymous researcher (via iDefense VCP), and an anonymous researcher (via HP TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative) reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2012-1887.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2012-1892.title: Microsoft Visual Studio Team Foundation Server Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2012-1892.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Visual Studio Team Foundation Server. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Microsoft Visual Studio Team Foundation Server software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Sunil Yadav of INR Labs (Network Intelligence India) reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-1892.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Microsoft Visual Studio Team Foundation Server software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2012-1895.title: Microsoft .NET Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, and Bypass Security Restrictions
CVE-2012-1895.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft .NET. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. A remote user can bypass security restrictions.The .NET Framework does not properly validate the permissions of certain objects performing reflection [CVE-2012-1895]. A remote user can create a specially crafted a specially crafted XAML browser application (XBAP) that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can create a specially crafted a specially crafted XBAP that, when loaded by the target user, will bypass Code Access Security (CAS) restrictions to obtain potentially sensitive information [CVE-2012-1896].A remote user can create a legitimate .NET application built with ADO.NET that is located in the same network directory as a specially crafted dynamic link library (DLL) file. Then, when the target user opens the .NET application, the specially crafted DLL will execute [CVE-2012-2519].The .Net Framework does not properly validate retrieved default web proxy settings [CVE-2012-4776]. A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can spoof the contents or the location of a proxy auto configuration (PAC) file to inject code into the currently running application, bypassing Code Access Security (CAS) restrictions.The software does not properly validate permissions of objects involved with Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) reflection [CVE-2012-4777]. A remote user can obtain the privileges of a logged in user. A Windows .NET Framework application can bypass CAS restrictions.James Forshaw of Context Information Security reported four of these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2012-1895.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A remote user can bypass security restrictions.

CVE-2012-1896.title: Microsoft .NET Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, and Bypass Security Restrictions
CVE-2012-1896.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft .NET. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. A remote user can bypass security restrictions.The .NET Framework does not properly validate the permissions of certain objects performing reflection [CVE-2012-1895]. A remote user can create a specially crafted a specially crafted XAML browser application (XBAP) that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can create a specially crafted a specially crafted XBAP that, when loaded by the target user, will bypass Code Access Security (CAS) restrictions to obtain potentially sensitive information [CVE-2012-1896].A remote user can create a legitimate .NET application built with ADO.NET that is located in the same network directory as a specially crafted dynamic link library (DLL) file. Then, when the target user opens the .NET application, the specially crafted DLL will execute [CVE-2012-2519].The .Net Framework does not properly validate retrieved default web proxy settings [CVE-2012-4776]. A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can spoof the contents or the location of a proxy auto configuration (PAC) file to inject code into the currently running application, bypassing Code Access Security (CAS) restrictions.The software does not properly validate permissions of objects involved with Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) reflection [CVE-2012-4777]. A remote user can obtain the privileges of a logged in user. A Windows .NET Framework application can bypass CAS restrictions.James Forshaw of Context Information Security reported four of these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2012-1896.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A remote user can bypass security restrictions.

CVE-2012-1904.title: RealPlayer Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2012-1904.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in RealPlayer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow or memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted MP4 file can trigger a memory corruption error [CVE-2012-1904]. Craig Young of nCircle reported this vulnerability.An ASMRuleBook parsing flaw can trigger code execution [CVE-2012-2406]. Tom Gallagher reported this vulnerability via Beyond Security's SecuriTeam Secure Disclosure.A buffer overflw in the RealJukebox media parser can cause code execution [CVE-2012-2411]. Sebastian Apelt reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-1904.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2012-1923.title: Helix Server Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Deny Service, and Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks and Let Local Users Obtain Passwords
CVE-2012-1923.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Helix Server. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A local user can obtain passwords.A remote user can send specially crafted authentication credentials to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-0942].A local user can obtain passwords stored in the '\Program Files\Real\Helix Server\adm_b_db\users\' file [CVE-2012-1923].A remote user can a send specially crafted DisplayString request to the SNMP master agent process on TCP port 705 to cause the target service to terminate [CVE-2012-2268].A remote user can establish and then immediately close a connection to the SNMP master agent process on TCP port 705 to cause the service to terminate [CVE-2012-2267].Several scripts do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser [CVE-2012-1984]. The code will originate from the site running the Helix Server software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote authenticated administrative user can submit a specially crafted URL to consume excessive stack memory and cause the target service to crash [CVE-2012-1985].Dmitriy Pletnev of Secunia Research, Derek Brown of TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative, and Tom Gallagher at Microsoft and Microsoft Vulnerability Research (MSVR) reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2012-1923.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can obtain passwords.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Helix Server software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2012-1951.title: Mozilla Firefox Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Spoof Web Sites, Obtain Information, and Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2012-1951.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. A remote user can spoof web sites.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-1948, CVE-2012-1949, CVE-2012-1951, CVE-2012-1952, CVE-2012-1953, CVE-2012-1954, CVE-2012-1958, CVE-2012-1962]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser [CVE-2012-1957, CVE-2012-1965, CVE-2012-1966, CVE-2012-1967]. The code will run in the security context of an arbitrary site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can spoof URLs via a drag and drop action [CVE-2012-1950].A remote user can spoof the location property [CVE-2012-1955].A remote user can bypass same-compartment security wrappers (SCSW) security restrictions [CVE-2012-1959].A remote user can exploit a flaw in the color management library to read potentially sensitive information [CVE-2012-1960].The browser may ignore the X-Frame-Options header, which may facilitate clickjacking attacks [CVE-2012-1961].A remote user can bypass Content Security Policy restrictions to potentially access OAuth 2.0 access tokens and OpenID credentials [CVE-2012-1963].A remote user can exploit a flaw in the certificate warning page to hijack clicks via a man-in-the-middle attack [CVE-2012-1964].Brian Smith, Gary Kwong, Christian Holler, Jesse Ruderman, Christoph Diehl, Chris Jones, Brad Lassey, Kyle Huey, Benoit Jacob, Bill McCloskey, Mario Gomes, Code Audit Labs, Abhishek Arya, Mariusz Mlynski, moz_bug_r_a4, Mario Heiderich, Arthur Gerkis, Bobby Holley, Tony Payne, Bill Keese, Frederic Buclin, Karthikeyan Bhargavan of Prosecco at INRIA, Matt McCutchen, and Soroush Dalili reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2012-1951.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with an arbitrary site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A remote user can spoof web sites.A remote user can bypass security restrictions.

CVE-2012-1954.title: Mozilla Firefox Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Spoof Web Sites, Obtain Information, and Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2012-1954.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. A remote user can spoof web sites.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-1948, CVE-2012-1949, CVE-2012-1951, CVE-2012-1952, CVE-2012-1953, CVE-2012-1954, CVE-2012-1958, CVE-2012-1962]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser [CVE-2012-1957, CVE-2012-1965, CVE-2012-1966, CVE-2012-1967]. The code will run in the security context of an arbitrary site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can spoof URLs via a drag and drop action [CVE-2012-1950].A remote user can spoof the location property [CVE-2012-1955].A remote user can bypass same-compartment security wrappers (SCSW) security restrictions [CVE-2012-1959].A remote user can exploit a flaw in the color management library to read potentially sensitive information [CVE-2012-1960].The browser may ignore the X-Frame-Options header, which may facilitate clickjacking attacks [CVE-2012-1961].A remote user can bypass Content Security Policy restrictions to potentially access OAuth 2.0 access tokens and OpenID credentials [CVE-2012-1963].A remote user can exploit a flaw in the certificate warning page to hijack clicks via a man-in-the-middle attack [CVE-2012-1964].Brian Smith, Gary Kwong, Christian Holler, Jesse Ruderman, Christoph Diehl, Chris Jones, Brad Lassey, Kyle Huey, Benoit Jacob, Bill McCloskey, Mario Gomes, Code Audit Labs, Abhishek Arya, Mariusz Mlynski, moz_bug_r_a4, Mario Heiderich, Arthur Gerkis, Bobby Holley, Tony Payne, Bill Keese, Frederic Buclin, Karthikeyan Bhargavan of Prosecco at INRIA, Matt McCutchen, and Soroush Dalili reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2012-1954.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with an arbitrary site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A remote user can spoof web sites.A remote user can bypass security restrictions.

CVE-2012-1984.title: Helix Server Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Deny Service, and Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks and Let Local Users Obtain Passwords
CVE-2012-1984.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Helix Server. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A local user can obtain passwords.A remote user can send specially crafted authentication credentials to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-0942].A local user can obtain passwords stored in the '\Program Files\Real\Helix Server\adm_b_db\users\' file [CVE-2012-1923].A remote user can a send specially crafted DisplayString request to the SNMP master agent process on TCP port 705 to cause the target service to terminate [CVE-2012-2268].A remote user can establish and then immediately close a connection to the SNMP master agent process on TCP port 705 to cause the service to terminate [CVE-2012-2267].Several scripts do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser [CVE-2012-1984]. The code will originate from the site running the Helix Server software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote authenticated administrative user can submit a specially crafted URL to consume excessive stack memory and cause the target service to crash [CVE-2012-1985].Dmitriy Pletnev of Secunia Research, Derek Brown of TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative, and Tom Gallagher at Microsoft and Microsoft Vulnerability Research (MSVR) reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2012-1984.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can obtain passwords.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Helix Server software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2012-1994.title: HP Systems Insight Manager Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Gain Access and Local Users Obtain Information
CVE-2012-1994.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in HP Systems Insight Manager. A remote user can gain elevated privileges on the target system. CVE-2012-2001.title: HP SNMP Agents for Linux Input Validation Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting and URL Redirection Attacks
CVE-2012-2001.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in HP SNMP Agents for Linux. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting and URL redirection attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2012-2001]. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the HP SNMP Agents software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can cause the target user's browser to redirect to a different URL [CVE-2012-2002].

CVE-2012-2010.title: OpenVMS ACMELOGIN Bug Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2012-2010.body: A vulnerability was reported in OpenVMS. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.On systems where the SYS$ACM system service for authentication is enabled, a local user can exploit a flaw in ACMELOGIN to obtain unauthorized access and gain elevated privileges.
CVE-2012-2010.extra: A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2012-2011.title: HP Web Jetadmin Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks

A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the HP Web Jetadmin software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Andrei Costin reported this vulnerability.

CVE-2012-2023.title: Adobe Illustrator Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2012-2023.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe Illustrator. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Felipe Andres Manzano (via the iSIGHT Partners Global Vulnerability Partnership), Justin Kim from Microsoft Malware Protection Center (MMPC) and Microsoft Vulnerability Research (MSVR), and Tielei Wang, Georgia Tech Information Security Center, (via Secunia SVCRP) reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2012-2023.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Felipe Andres Manzano (via the iSIGHT Partners Global Vulnerability Partnership), Justin Kim from Microsoft Malware Protection Center (MMPC) and Microsoft Vulnerability Research (MSVR), and Tielei Wang, Georgia Tech Information Security Center, (via Secunia SVCRP) reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2012-2024.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2012-2025.title: Adobe Illustrator Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2012-2025.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe Illustrator. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Felipe Andres Manzano (via the iSIGHT Partners Global Vulnerability Partnership), Justin Kim from Microsoft Malware Protection Center (MMPC) and Microsoft Vulnerability Research (MSVR), and Tielei Wang, Georgia Tech Information Security Center, (via Secunia SVCRP) reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2012-2025.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2012-2026.title: Adobe Illustrator Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2012-2026.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe Illustrator. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Felipe Andres Manzano (via the iSIGHT Partners Global Vulnerability Partnership), Justin Kim from Microsoft Malware Protection Center (MMPC) and Microsoft Vulnerability Research (MSVR), and Tielei Wang, Georgia Tech Information Security Center, (via Secunia SVCRP) reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2012-2026.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2012-2028.title: Adobe Photoshop Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2012-2028.body: A vulnerability was reported in Adobe Photoshop. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.nine8 of Code Audit Labs of vulnhunt.com reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2012-2028.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2012-2029.title: Adobe Shockwave Player Memory Corruption Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2012-2029.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe Shockwave Player. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted Shockwave content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Rodrigo Rubira Branco of Qualys Vulnerability & Malware Research Labs (VMRL) and Honggang Ren of Fortinet's FortiGuard Labs each reported some of these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2012-2029.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2012-2030.title: Adobe Shockwave Player Memory Corruption Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2012-2030.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe Shockwave Player. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted Shockwave content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Rodrigo Rubira Branco of Qualys Vulnerability & Malware Research Labs (VMRL) and Honggang Ren of Fortinet's FortiGuard Labs each reported some of these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2012-2030.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Rodrigo Rubira Branco of Qualys Vulnerability & Malware Research Labs (VMRL) and Honggang Ren of Fortinet's FortiGuard Labs each reported some of these vulnerabilities.
